Class RC

  • java.lang.Object
    • RC

  • public class RC
extends java.lang.Object
    This class finds the number with the largest amount of digits in its cycle from 1/first to 1/last.
    Approach:
    We start by dividing 10/number, find the result (integer) and find the reminder.
    The result is part of the cycle while the reminder * 10 is part of the next interation.
    Every iteration we check if the reminder already exists in the reminders array. If so, it's a cycle that will repeat forever. If not, we add it to the array and keep the division.

      • divide

        public static int divide(int a)
        This method returns the size of the cycle of 1/a. For example, 1/7 will return 6 since 1/7 = 0.142857....
        Parameters:
        a - The integer we want to divide.
        Returns:
        int

      • reminderInArray

        public static boolean reminderInArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> rems,
                      int r)
        This method returns true of the the number r exists in the ArrayList rems.
        Parameters:
        rems - An ArrayList of integer.
        r - The number we are looking for.
        Returns:
        boolean
